definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: The English empiricism aestheticians turn the study of beauty to the subjective of human.
sentences.chinese: 英國經驗主義美學家的美學研究轉向了人的主觀心理。

sentences.english: Because of this, Rorty claims reserve Pragmatism and give up Empiricism.
sentences.chinese: 所以羅蒂主張保留實用主義而把經驗主義加以剔除。

sentences.english: But there are different respects in which one can be an empiricist.
sentences.chinese: 不過，經驗主義可以體現在不同方面。

sentences.english: Another kind of empiricism has to do with where we get our knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 另一種經驗主義與我們從哪裏獲取知識有關。

sentences.english: From an empiricist point of view, this is a baffling situation.
sentences.chinese: 從經驗主義的觀點看，這是一個令人困惑的局面。

sentences.english: Locke is a modern age empiricism a generalization of, its thought influence is profound.
sentences.chinese: 洛克是近代經驗主義集大成者，其思想影響深遠。

sentences.english: It is in this sense that Comte repudiates empiricism.
sentences.chinese: 正是從這個意義上說，孔德拋棄了經驗主義。

sentences.english: Before Locke, Becon and Hobbes are two supreme British empiricists.
sentences.chinese: 洛克之前培根和霍布斯堪稱英國經驗主義雙璧。

sentences.english: Action and experimentation are the cornerstones of empiricism.
sentences.chinese: 行動和嘗試是經驗主義的基石。

sentences.english: OK, so that's one kind of empiricism.
This reason was not full, violates the empiricism to be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 這個理由並不充分，犯了經驗主義錯誤。

definition: the philosophy of materialism, doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
(idiom) to freely air one's views/to be heard far and wide/to attract a lot of attention
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
